translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Great Chapter
The Question about the Characteristic of Energy
The King said:
“Revered Nāgasena, what is the characteristic of energy?”

original: “Upatthambhanalakkhaṇaṁ, mahārāja, vīriyaṁ, vīriyūpatthambhitā sabbe kusalā dhammā na parihāyantī”ti.
analyzed: upatthambhana lakkhaṇa mahā rāja vīriya vīriya upatthambhitā sabbe kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na parihāyanti iti
translated: “The characteristic of energy, sire, is that of supporting. All wholesome states do not decline when they are supported by energy.”
“Make a simile.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, puriso gehe patante aññena dārunā upatthambheyya, upatthambhitaṁ santaṁ evaṁ taṁ gehaṁ na pateyya;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja purisaḥ gehe patante aññena dārunā upatthambheyya upatthambhitam santam evam tam geham na pateyya
translated: “As, sire, a man might support a house that was falling down with another piece of timber, and when it was supported it would not fall down;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, upatthambhanalakkhaṇaṁ vīriyaṁ, vīriyūpatthambhitā sabbe kusalā dhammā na parihāyantī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja upatthambhana lakkhaṇam vīriya vīriya upatthambhi tā sabbe kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na parihāyanti iti
translated: even so, sire, the characteristic of energy is that of supporting. All wholesome states do not decline when they are supported by energy.”
“Make a further simile.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, parittakaṁ senaṁ mahatī senā bhañjeyya, tato rājā aññamaññaṁ anussāreyya
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja parittakam senam mahatī senā bhañjeyya tatas rājā aññamaññam anussāreyya
translated: “As, sire, a small army might be defeated by a large army, then the king might encourage one another

original: anupeseyya attano parittakāya senāya balaṁ anupadaṁ dadeyya, tāya saddhiṁ parittakā
analyzed: anupeseyya attanaḥ parittakāya senāya balam anupadam dadeyya tāya saddhim parittakā
translated: and send out his small army in support, giving it strength, and that small army,
supported by that, might defeat the large army;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, upatthambhanalakkhaṇaṁ vīriyaṁ, vīriyūpatthambhitā sabbe kusalā dhammā na parihāyanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja upatthambhana lakkhaṇam vīriya vīriya upatthambhitā sabbe kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na parihāyanti
translated: in the same way, sire, energy has the characteristic of supporting; all wholesome states do not decline when they are supported by energy.
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘vīriyavā kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako akusalaṁ pajahati, kusalaṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: vīriyavā kho bhikkhave ariya sāvakaḥ akusalam pajahati kusalam bhāveti
translated: ‘The Ariyan disciple who is energetic abandons the unwholesome and develops the wholesome,
he abandons the reproachable and develops the irreproachable,
he maintains himself in purity.’
“You are skilled, revered Nāgasena.”
Question twelve: on the characteristic of energy.
